model_answer: The screen displays the text "Old English + French = Middle English" between 00:03:23 and 00:03:42. Answer: A.

The correct answer is C: [00:03:42 - 00:04:10]. The slide labeled "02 LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT" shows the impact of the Norman Conquest on the development of the English language. After the Norman Conquest of England in 1066, French became the official language of the new Norman aristocracy, while Old English continued to be spoken by the lower and middle classes. This led to the development of Middle English, which was a mixture of Old English and French.
